thread.title: Comment on UK Choir sings “My Old Kentucky Home” at State Capitol by UK school of music grad
thread.title_full: Comment on UK Choir sings “My Old Kentucky Home” at State Capitol by UK school of music grad

author: UK school of music grad
title: Comment on UK Choir sings “My Old Kentucky Home” at State Capitol by UK school of music grad
text:
Posted in Main | 10 Responses 
The University of Kentucky Men’s Choir stopped by the Capitol building in Frankfort this week to sing “My Old Kentucky Home” in the rotunda. Governor Beshear was one of about 20 people around to hear it. Thanks to Rob Haynes for filming it and sharing it with KSR. 
It’s pretty awesome… 
I love working at the State Capitol. Thanks to the University of Kentucky Men's Choir for the concert today. -with Liles Bennett Taylor Christin Miller Julie Garland-Stevenson 
Posted by Rob Haynes on Tuesday, October 20, 2015 Article written by Drew Franklin I can recite every line from Forrest Gump, blindfolded. Follow me on Twitter: @DrewFranklinKSR 10 responses to “UK Choir sings “My Old Kentucky Home” at State Capitol” jeff j October 22, 2015 at 5:55   
please tell me the “Gov” . didn’t join in the chorus Rixter October 22, 2015 at 5:56   
What does this possibly have to do with the U of L sex scandal? Suffering Fools October 22, 2015 at 6:29 pm | Permalink 
It demonstrates the beauty and grandeur of the Commonwealth they have disgraced by doing these things within its borders. rick October 22, 2015 at 6:58   
sounds like crap… intheshadow October 22, 2015 at 7:45 pm | Permalink 
I totally agree Rick. I truly HATE IT when someone??? decides they want to keep the words to a beautiful song and then they TOTALLY change the music. Why not just sing the words to My Old Kentucky Home to the tune of Old McDonald Had A Farm…it would have sounded much better than what they did, which to me was very disrespectful! WestKYCATFan October 22, 2015 at 7:20   
If you don’t get chills or a little misty then you’re not alive or not a Kentuckian. That was unreal! intheshadow October 22, 2015 at 7:49 pm | Permalink 
Are you a music major at UK, paid to leave your comment? Great lyrics and a beautiful song, that was totally destroyed with some off the shelf made up tune. If you can sing, then you should be able to sing the correct melody. THAT version of My Old Kentucky Home was unrecognizable. UK school of music grad October 22, 2015 at 8:12 pm | Permalink 
Intheshadow – do you know the song? Here’s another performance by the UK Men’s Choir of the same arrangement with a little less reverb. Recognize it now? It’s a pretty basic choral arrangement up until the ending, where it gets barbershop-ish. https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=xhKpRPjSHAM Micah October 22, 2015 at 7:58   
That was awesome. I don’t know what all the complaining is about. this is simply the choral version of the song. The reverb may have been a little much but they did an awesome job! Dave Rust October 22, 2015 at 8:09   
Incredible. Stopped me and my wife and our tracks. Couldn’t find enough Kleenex. I don’t think I’ve ever heard A better rendition. God bless our state although I have lived in Indiana for 62 years. Post Comment - New and Improved (not really, it just works now)
